attribution: Adapted with permission from UCLES, Higher School Certificate Mathematics, June1931, Paper3, Question3.
title: The Hosepipe

children.value:
A hose pipe delivers a jet of water 
$\valuedef{d}{2}{cm}$
 in diameter, which impinges horizontally and normally on a side of a box weighing 
$\valuedef{m}{1}{kg}$
, whose base rests in contact with a rough horizontal floor; the coefficient of friction between the box and floor is 
$\valuedef{\mu }{\frac{1}{2}}{}$
.

Assuming that the water is of density 
$\valuedef{\rho }{1000}{kg\,  m\sup {-3}}$
 and does not recoil from the box, determine the smallest velocity of the jet that will cause the box to move.
